isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - REMOVE - COUNTERSHAFT BEARINGS

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from the rear bearing bore of the case ( Figure 70).

figure.caption: Figure 70. Remove Snap Ring From Rear Bearing Bore

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul against the rear of the right countershaft to move the assembly forward as far as possible until the snap ring groove in the front bearing is exposed ( Figure 71).

figure.caption: Figure 71. Move Assembly as Far Forward as Possible

note.para: If the front bearing snap ring groove cannot be exposed (due to variances in the thickness of the case), use a punch between the hub of the countershaft drive gear and the inner race of the bearing to move the gear forward on the shaft.

step1.para: Remove the snap ring from the rear countershaft bearing bore and install in the front bearing snap ring groove ( Figure 72).

figure.caption: Figure 72. Remove Snap Ring From Rear Countershaft Bearing Bore and Install in Front Bearing Snap Ring Groove

step1.para: Loosen, but do not remove, the two mainshaft rear bearing retainers ( Figure 73).

figure.caption: Figure 73. Loosen Mainshaft Rear Bearing Retainers

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul to drive the assembly to the rear as far as possible to partially unseat the front bearing from the shaft ( Figure 74).

figure.caption: Figure 74. Drive Assembly to Rear as Far as Possible

step1.para: Move the countershaft forward and remove the front bearing with a puller or pry bars ( Figure 75).

figure.caption: Figure 75. Move Countershaft Forward and Remove Front Bearing

step1.para: Use a blunt punch or equivalent from inside the case to drive the gear bearings to the rear and from the case bore ( Figure 76).

figure.caption: Figure 76. Drive Gear Bearings to Rear

caution.para: Removal procedures will damage the bearings. Removal should not be attempted unless replacement of the bearings is planned.
